alert.note: Alert for Cumberland; Gloucester; Salem (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 4:58PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Cumberland, Salem and southern Gloucester Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 457 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Hope Creek to Greenwich to near Big Stone Beach. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Vineland, Millville, Bridgeton, Cumberland, Glassboro, Clayton, Salem, Buena, Laurel Lake, Woodstown, Alloway, Quinton, Newfield, Elmer, Greenwich, Shiloh, Newport, Franklinville, Leesburg and Hancocks Bridge. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for northern Delaware...and southern New Jersey. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch also remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for central Delaware... and southern New Jersey.
